raw.title: [BIP-540] Enable Gauge for [rsETH/ETHx on Ethereum Mainnet] and [WETH/rsETH on Polygon zkEVM]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payloads
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/782

**Summary:**
Kelp proposes to add a veBAL gauge for the [rsETH/ETHx on Ethereum Mainnet] and [WETH/rsETH on Polygon zkEVM] on [Balancer]

**Gauge Address:** 
Mainnet: https://etherscan.io/address/0x0BcDb6d9b27Bd62d3De605393902C7d1a2c71Aab?

Polygon zkEVM: https://etherscan.io/address/0x047301b311741ce6C007FFEF7f182Ec93ab07968#readContract

**References/Useful links:**

    • Website: https://kelpdao.xyz/restake/
    • Documentation: https://kelp.gitbook.io/kelp
    • Github Public Repo: https://github.com/Kelp-DAO/KelpDAO-contracts 
    • Twitter: https://twitter.com/KelpDAO

**Protocol Description:**

rsETH is the largest LST-based liquid restaked token on the EigenLayer ecosystem. It represents the liquidity of the underlying assets that have been deposited on Kelp. rsETH provides liquidity for the restaked positions, accumulates the rewards, and simplifies rewards management for AVSs

Kelp has more than 113,000 ETH worth of assets restaked by over 14,000 users. All of this is within 7 weeks of launching on Mainnet.

By providing liquidity for the restaked positions, rsETH allows for a seamless experience to engage with DeFi activities and maximize rewards.

**Motivation:**

Kelp is seeking to establish the [rsETH/ETHx on Mainnet] and [WETH/rsETH on Polygon zkEVM] on Balancer to further enrich the liquidity of rsETH. This move aims to enhance the trading experience of users, making it more accessible for users while generating additional value for the Kelp community.

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** Kelp currently operates with a multi-sig wallet. The protocol is planning to transition to decentralized governance soon

2. **Oracles:** Kelp is working with Redstone to create price feeds of rsETH.

3. **Audits:** Kelp's smart contracts are audited by Sigma Prime and Code4rena. 
Sigma Prime Report: https://kelpdao.xyz/audits/smartcontracts/SigmaPrime.pdf
Code4rena: https://code4rena.com/reports/2023-11-kelp

4. **Centralization vectors:** Centralization vectors currently are around upgradeability via proxy multi-sig and front-end hosting.

Our goal is to migrate Kelp away from these vectors.

5. **Market History:** Kelp has seen meteoric growth in TVL in the last few weeks with TVL over 113k ETH and >14,000 holders of rsETH.
 
The balancer pools are already live and are available here: 

[Mainnet Pool](https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x7761b6e0daa04e70637d81f1da7d186c205c2ade00000000000000000000065d) 
[Polygon zkEVM Pool](https://app.balancer.fi/#/zkevm/pool/0xffc865fcb34e754fad4b0144139b9c28c81c3eff00000000000000000000005f)

Gauges: 
[Mainnet Gauge](https://etherscan.io/address/0x0BcDb6d9b27Bd62d3De605393902C7d1a2c71Aab?)
[Polygon zkEVM Gauge](https://etherscan.io/address/0x047301b311741ce6C007FFEF7f182Ec93ab07968#readContract  )

6. **Value:** The balancer pool is the first liquidity pool on Polygon zkEVM and is aimed at providing liquidity to the growing community.

**Technical Specifications:**

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0x0BcDb6d9b27Bd62d3De605393902C7d1a2c71Aab`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

gauge(address):`0x047301b311741ce6C007FFEF7f182Ec93ab07968`
gaugeType(string): `Polygon zkEVM`

choices: No, this is not the way

https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1155

Summary:

Kelp proposes to add a veBAL gauge for the [rsETH/WETH] on [Balancer]

References/Useful links:

• Website: https://kelpdao.xyz/restake/

• Documentation: https://kelp.gitbook.io/kelp

• Github Public Repo: https://github.com/Kelp-DAO/KelpDAO-contracts

Protocol Description:

rsETH is the largest LST-based liquid restaked token on the EigenLayer ecosystem. It represents the liquidity of the underlying assets that have been deposited on Kelp. rsETH provides liquidity for the restaked positions, accumulates the rewards, and simplifies rewards management for AVSs

Kelp has more than 260,000 ETH worth of assets restaked by over 40,000 users across multiple L2s. All of this is within 6 months of launch

By providing liquidity for the restaked positions, rsETH allows for a seamless experience to engage with DeFi activities and maximize rewards.

Motivation:

Kelp is seeking to establish the [rsETH/wETH on Ethereum] and on Balancer to further enrich the liquidity of rsETH. This move aims to enhance the trading experience of users, making it more accessible for users while generating additional value for the Kelp community.

Specifications:

1. Governance: Kelp currently operates with a multi-sig wallet. The protocol is planning to transition to decentralized governance soon

2. Oracles: Kelp’s mainnet rseTH rate provider has been reviewed [here](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/rsETHRateProvider.md).

3. Audits: Kelp’s smart contracts are audited by Sigma Prime and Code4rena.

* Sigma Prime Report: https://kelpdao.xyz/audits/smartcontracts/SigmaPrime.pdf
* Code4rena: [Code4rena | Keeping high severity bugs out of production](https://code4rena.com/reports/2023-11-kelp)
* MixBytes: [KELPDAO LRT-ETH SECURITY AUDIT REPORT](https://kelpdao.xyz/audits/smartcontracts/mixbytes.pdf)

4. Centralization vectors: Centralization vectors currently are around upgradeability via proxy multi-sig and front-end hosting.

Our goal is to migrate Kelp away from these vectors.

5. Market History: Kelp has seen meteoric growth in TVL in the last few weeks with TVL over 260k ETH and >40,000 holders of rsETH across mainnet and L2s.

The balancer pools are already live and are available on Ethereum

Ethereum pool:

https://app.balancer.fi/#/ethereum/pool/0x58aadfb1afac0ad7fca1148f3cde6aedf5236b6d00000000000000000000067f

Gauge Address: https://etherscan.io/address/0xdf04E3a7ab9857a16FB97174e0f1001aa44380AF

6. Value: The balancer pool is one of the few LRT pools on Ethereum and is aimed at providing liquidity to the growing community.

Technical Specifications:

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0xdf04E3a7ab9857a16FB97174e0f1001aa44380AF`

gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-727] Enable wstETH-weETHs Gauge [Ethereum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1456

**Summary**

The [ether.fi ](http://ether.fi/) team proposes a Balancer Boosted Gauge for a wstETH-weETHs pool on Ethereum, with no emissions cap. This will serve as a 100% yield bearing pair.

References/Useful links:

• Website - https://www.ether.fi/

• Documentation - [ether.fi Whitepaper | ether.fi](https://etherfi.gitbook.io/etherfi/ether.fi-whitepaper)

• Github Page - [etherfi-protocol · GitHub](https://github.com/etherfi-protocol)

• Discord - [ether.fi](https://discord.com/invite/zqGzcuQWvD)

• Twitter - https://twitter.com/ether_fi

**Protocol Description:**

[ether.fi ](http://ether.fi/) is a decentralised, non-custodial liquid staking protocol built on Ethereum, allowing users to stake their ETH and participate in the DeFi ecosystem without losing liquidity. The protocols weETHs is a liquid restaking token, serving as a representation of ETH staked on the Beacon Chain and restaked on Symbiotic. Users can deposit ETH into the liquidity pool on Ethereum Mainnet to mint weETHs, hold weETHs to accrue rewards, and use weETHs within DeFi or swap it back to ETH at any time via the liquidity pool. The protocol currently employs a permissioned validator set, however this will transition to permissionless based on the protocol roadmap.

ETH staked through the[ ether.fi ](http://ether.fi/) liquidity pool into weETHs accrues normal Ethereum staking rewards and will also be natively restaked with Symbiotic. Staking with weETHs on[ ether.fi ](http://ether.fi/) automatically restakes that ETH to Symbiotic and accrues normal staking rewards while allowing users to keep composability on their weETHs in other DeFi protocols. Being a liquid representation of staked Ethereum, the price of the token is aligned to the price of ETH.

Through these mechanisms, weETHs acts as a conduit for individuals to engage in Ethereum’s staking & restaking process with the added liquidity, making it easier for them to enter and exit staking positions while also benefiting from boosted rewards.

**Motivation:**

[ether.fi ](http://ether.fi/) is looking to seed a wstETH-weETHs pool on balancer to serve as a primary source of liquidity for weETHs on Ethereum. Incentivizing a Balancer pool will continue to boost the liquidity of the LRT on Ethereum. Higher liquidity ensures that traders and investors can easily enter or exit positions, which is essential for the overall usability and attractiveness of the LRT token within the DeFi ecosystem.

**Specifications:**

1. Governance: - Currently, the protocol utilizes a DAO and a governance token model to push large initiatives and objectives.

2. Oracles: - The Protocol relies on an oracle for withdrawals and beacon state, however, the reliance on an oracle for beacon state is set to go away in an upcoming Ethereum upgrade. The Oracle is based on the hash consensus mechanism and run by the internal & external committee members.

3. Audits: - Audit reports for the[ ether.fi ](http://ether.fi/) protocol are found on the GitBook page -[ Audits - ether.fi](https://etherfi.gitbook.io/etherfi/security/audits). The audits have been carried out by reputable firms such as Certik, Zellic, Nethermind, Omniscia and Solidified to ensure the security of the protocol. An audit competition was also recently completed through Hats Finance.
4. Centralization vectors: - The centralization vectors primarily relate to the Oracle which is run by a multi-party committee. The price (staking rewards for rebasing) and the validator management (spinning up new validators and exiting them for liquidation) are also tied into the functionality of the protocol oracle.
5. Market History: - weETHs has been deployed and functional since June '24. Market history and protocol information can be found here on the[ ether.fi ](http://ether.fi/) Dune dashboard -[ https://dune.com/ether_fi/etherfi ](https://dune.com/ether_fi/etherfi)
6. Value: - The wstETH-weETHs pool on Balancer is intended to serve as one of the primary liquidity sources for the token on Ethereum. The pairing of wstETH with weETHs will maintain the originally intended smooth trading experience, while yielding more rewards for the liquidity providers.

weETHs on Ethereum: 0x917cee801a67f933f2e6b33fc0cd1ed2d5909d88

wstETH/weETHs Base pool on Balancer:[ Balancer 2 ](https://balancer.fi/pools/ethereum/v2/0x2ab8df7429f4fce60eb2c1233f0326767765e2f30000000000000000000006da)

**Specification**

Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0x0Bb8B971AaF99eddfddE2e71736eBEBe8CC7769b`

gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

choices: No, this is not the way

PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/970

Summary:

Kelp proposes to add a veBAL gauge for the [wrsETH/WETH] on Balancer]

Protocol Description:

rsETH is one of the largest LST-based liquid restaked token on the EigenLayer ecosystem. It represents the liquidity of the underlying assets that have been deposited on Kelp. rsETH provides liquidity for the restaked positions, accumulates the rewards, and simplifies rewards management for AVSs

Technical Specifications:

raw.title: [BIP-657] Enable APW-ETH Gauge with 2% Cap [Ethereum]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1153

**Summary:**

>This proposal aims to approve the creation of a new gauge on Ethereum Mainnet with a 2% cap for APW-ETH

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
    • Website: https://spectra.finance/
    • Documentation: https://docs.spectra.finance/ || https://dev.spectra.finance/
    • Github Page: https://github.com/perspectivefi

**Protocol Description:**

> Spectra is an EVM-centric protocol for interest rate derivatives with an easy-to-use flagship app. The Spectra protocol is permissionless, meaning its services are entirely open for public use. Spectra’s Yield Token and Principal Token, minted on top of ERC-4626 interest-bearing tokens, are core protocol primitives. Spectra separates the right to principal from future yield via a process called yield tokenization. This process unlocks new financial possibilities beyond standalone interest-bearing tokens. Anyone can create new markets at will, swap yield derivatives, or become a liquidity provider. Spectra's native token, [APW](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/spectra-2), powers it's flywheel tokenomics. Holders can lock APW into veAPW and use it to vote on LM, receive bribes and vote on governance proposals.

**Motivation:**

> Spectra only has one primary source of liquidity and that is Balancer's APW <> ETH pool. We plan to deepen this relationship with tokenisation of Balancer Pool Tokens and veBAL liquid wrappers.

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** Spectra is a decentralized, community-governed protocol by the APW token holders. They can discuss, propose and vote on upgrades. Any APW holder can lock their tokens to convert into veAPW. More info on Spectra's governance can be found [here](https://app.spectra.finance/governance).

2. **Oracles:** Spectra does rely on price oracles to determine price data

3. **Audits:** [Audit Info](https://docs.spectra.finance/security/audits)

4. **Centralization vectors:** None

5. **Market History:** The APW/ETH pool was created approx. 7 days ago (29th of June, 2024). APW has been on the market since 18 May 2021, in that time it has not experienced sever volatility. Link to [Coingecko](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/spectra-2), [Pool](https://etherscan.io/address/0x093254005743b7af89e24f645730ba2dd8441333) and [Gauge](https://etherscan.io/address/0x2fa29bbfd19314b3faf170dc7826ef69372203a6).
 
6. **Value:** This is expected to be the primary pool for this token. APW liquidity mining started a couple weeks ago so users are expected to be either trading out of APW, locking it for governance or trading it into the liquid version of veAPW.

**Technical Specification:**

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:

gauge(address): `0x2fa29bbfd19314b3faf170dc7826ef69372203a6`
gaugeType(string): `Ethereum`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: Proposal to enable a veBAL gauge for the WBTC/pumpBTC pool on Ethereum to provide liquidity and rewards, supported by unanimous voting and positive market signals.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous voter support with strong early and stable voting patterns.
Positive market impact with price increase of 2.4% and TVL increase of 5.1%.
Similar past proposals enabling new gauges had unanimous support and positive market outcomes.
Proposal provides liquidity benefits and aligns with protocol growth objectives.
key_arguments_against: Forum discussion sentiment is mostly neutral with one negative comment expressing concerns.
Governance token for pumpBTC is not yet released, creating some uncertainty.

evidence.quote: Proposal to enable a veBAL gauge for the WBTC/pumpBTC pool; forum comments mostly neutral with one negative comment.
Unanimous votes for 'Yes, let's do it' with stable, early participation and strong voting power.
Both similar proposals had unanimous yes votes and positive price and TVL impacts, supporting gauge enablement.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The proposal received unanimous voting support with early and stable participation, indicating strong community backing.
• Positive market indicators including a 2.4% price increase and 5.1% TVL growth suggest beneficial impact.
• Similar past proposals enabling new gauges also led to positive outcomes and unanimous approvals, reinforcing this approach.
• Forum sentiment is mostly neutral with one negative comment, but does not strongly oppose the proposal, so the recommendation aligns sufficiently with community views.
